intro: Diplotaxis griffithii, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that are followed by elongated seed pods. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Diplotaxis griffithii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
